message: the OurUser class does NOT need the set_table_name call.  STI automatically handles this providing the users table has a `type` field since your User class is not abstract.  As for the `belongs_to` you want to inject an 'inherited' method onto the User class (inside if your module.) so when User is inherited you can get the class name and call belongs_to on that class giving the :class_name the proper value. ie: on `included` in your module, you add an `inherited` method to the class (probably want to chain it to not override any others.) which in turn adds what it needs to the inherited class.  It's time to be meta.
